title: Dereck Chisora throws down the gauntlet to Oleksandr Usyk ahead of David Price fight
text:
Dereck Chisora has thrown down the gauntlet to heavyweight rival Oleksandr Usyk.

Usyk, the former undisputed crusierweight world champion, made a successful debut up at heavyweight by stopping Chazz Witherspoon in seven rounds earlier this month.

The two-time Olympic champion is a dangerous new addition to the heavyweight division and is expected to be in line for a world title shot next year.

Dereck Chisora has thrown down the gauntlet to heavyweight rival Oleksandr Usyk

But Chisora, who is preparing to face David Price in their all-British dust up this weekend, admitted he will not avoid Usyk and would take the fight if it was offered to him.

'He still needs to stop juggling balls, it's not a circus,' Chisora told Sky Sports as he slammed Usyk's unconventional training methods.

'He came and did what he needed to do, stop juggling balls and dancing - nobody wants to see a dancing show.

'This is not dancing with the stars, it's a boxing match and you know what? I watnt to have that fight.

'I'll take it 100 per cent, no shadiness.'
